docs.snippet: New York University will offer more classes, broaden its allowance for transfer credits and advise students on creating schedules to finish in three years.

headline.print_headline: N.Y.U. Offers Path to Finish Degree Faster
headline.main: College Costs Too Much? N.Y.U. Paves Way to Graduate Faster

docs.snippet: The Frugal Family heads to Thailand and learns why a surprising number of people travel abroad to get fillings and crowns, whitening and implants.

headline.main: A Family Adventure in Medical Tourism

docs.snippet: Analysts say the network is spreading disinformation and undermining Western democracies, but its executives say it is just providing an “alternative” view.

headline.print_headline: Journalism or Propaganda? A Russian TV Network Blurs the Line
headline.main: Russia’s RT Network: Is It More BBC or K.G.B.?

docs.snippet: Employees of the Environmental Protection Agency are calling their senators to try to defeat Scott Pruitt’s confirmation to run the agency.

headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Workers Fight to Stop  Confirmation
headline.main: E.P.A. Workers Try to Block Pruitt in Show of Defiance

docs.snippet: David M. Friedman, President Trump’s nominee as envoy to Israel, has close ties to a religious settlement deep in the Israeli-occupied West Bank.

headline.print_headline: Cautious Optimism for Israelis Deep in West Bank
headline.main: Israeli Settlement Sees Friendly Faces in Trump Administration

docs.snippet: Mr. Lilly, a fly fisherman, outfitter and retailer, came to embrace catch and release in order to protect the fish population in his native Montana.

headline.print_headline: Conservationist Bud Lilly, Advocate of Catch and Release, Is Dead at 91
headline.main: Conservationist Bud Lilly, ‘a Trout’s Best Friend,’ Dies at 91

docs.snippet: In the fight over the Dakota Access Pipeline, Native American activists achieved one of the most galvanizing environmental victories in years — and it all began with a group of teenagers.

headline.main: The Youth Group That Launched a Movement at Standing Rock

docs.snippet: Wednesday: Keeping up with the cold, a verdict in the Etan Patz case, and the 5-cent plastic bag fee.

headline.print_headline: New York Today: Winter Health Watch
headline.main: New York Today: Winter Health Watch

docs.snippet: Independent shops have become magnets for a growing movement, with some taking a protest role beyond deciding what titles to display.

headline.print_headline: Bookstores Stoke Resistance With Action, Not Just Books
headline.main: Bookstores Stoke Trump Resistance With Action, Not Just Words

docs.snippet: In the New York region and around the country, many workers and business owners chose to not work as part of a protest of the Trump administration’s policies toward immigrants.

headline.print_headline: Immigrants Stay Home, and Their Absence Reverberates
headline.main: On a ‘Day Without Immigrants,’ Workers Show Their Presence by Staying Home
